approve(uint256,uint256,address).details: Allows the client or an admin to officially approve a deposit that has been submitted by a contractor.

params._amountApprove: Amount to approve for the deposit.
params._contractId: ID of the deposit to be approved.
params._receiver: Address of the contractor receiving the approved amount.

approveReturn(uint256).details: This changes the status of the deposit to allow the client to withdraw their funds.

params._contractId: ID of the deposit for which the return is approved.

cancelReturn(uint256,uint8).details: Allows reverting the deposit status from RETURN_REQUESTED to an active state.

params._contractId: The unique identifier of the deposit for which the return is being cancelled.
params._status: The new status to set for the deposit, must be ACTIVE, SUBMITTED, APPROVED, or COMPLETED.

claim(uint256).details: Allows contractors to retrieve funds that have been approved for their work.

params._contractId: Identifier of the deposit from which funds will be claimed.

createDispute(uint256).details: Initiates a dispute status for a deposit that can be activated by the client or contractor when they disagree on the previously submitted work.

params._contractId: ID of the deposit where the dispute is to be created. This function can only be called if the deposit status is either RETURN_REQUESTED or SUBMITTED.

params._deposit: Details of the deposit to be created.

getContractorDataHash(bytes,bytes32).details: This external function computes the hash value for the contractor data using the provided data and salt.

params._salt: Salt value for generating the hash.

returns._0: Hash value of the contractor data.

params._adminManager: Address of the adminManager contract of the escrow platform.
params._client: Address of the client initiating actions within the escrow.

params._hash: Hash of the data to be signed.
params._signature: Signature byte array associated with the hash.

returns._0: The magic value if the signature is valid, otherwise 0xffffffff.

refill(uint256,uint256).details: Enhances a deposit's total amount, which can be crucial for ongoing contracts needing extra funds.

params._amountAdditional: The extra amount to be added to the deposit.
params._contractId: The identifier of the deposit to be refilled.

requestReturn(uint256).details: The contract must be in an eligible state to request a return (not in disputed or already returned status).

params._contractId: ID of the deposit for which the return is requested.

resolveDispute(uint256,uint8,uint256,uin.details: Handles the resolution of disputes by assigning the funds according to the outcome of the dispute.     Admin intervention is required to resolve disputes to ensure fairness.

params._clientAmount: Amount to be allocated to the client if Split or Client wins.
params._contractId: ID of the deposit where the dispute occurred.
params._contractorAmount: Amount to be allocated to the contractor if Split or Contractor wins. This function ensures that the total resolution amounts do not exceed the deposited amount and adjusts the status of the deposit based on the dispute outcome.
params._winner: Specifies who the winner is: Client, Contractor, or Split.

submit(uint256,bytes,bytes32).details: This function allows the contractor to submit their work details for a contract.

params._contractId: ID of the deposit to be submitted.

transferClientOwnership(address).details: Can only be called by the account recovery module registered in the system.

params._newAccount: The address to which the client ownership will be transferred.

transferContractorOwnership(uint256,addr.details: Can only be called by the account recovery module registered in the system.

params._contractId: The identifier of the contract for which contractor ownership is being transferred.
params._newAccount: The address to which the contractor ownership will be transferred.

updateAdminManager(address).details: Restricts the function to be callable only by the current owner of the admin manager.

params._adminManager: The new address of the admin manager contract.

withdraw(uint256).details: Handles the withdrawal process including fee deductions and state updates.

params._contractId: Identifier of the deposit from which funds will be withdrawn.

approve(uint256,uint256,address).notice: Approves a submitted deposit by the client or an administrator.

approveReturn(uint256).notice: Approves the return of funds, which can be called by the contractor or platform admin.

cancelReturn(uint256,uint8).notice: Cancels a previously requested return and resets the deposit's status.

claim(uint256).notice: Claims the approved funds for a contract by the contractor.

createDispute(uint256).notice: Creates a dispute over a specific deposit.

deposit((address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: Creates a new deposit for a fixed-price contract within the escrow system.

getContractorDataHash(bytes,bytes32).notice: Generates a hash for the contractor data.

isValidSignature(bytes32,bytes).notice: Returns whether the signature provided is valid for the provided data.

refill(uint256,uint256).notice: Adds additional funds to a specific deposit.

requestReturn(uint256).notice: Requests the return of funds by the client for a specific contract.

resolveDispute(uint256,uint8,uint256,uin.notice: Resolves a dispute over a specific deposit.

submit(uint256,bytes,bytes32).notice: Submits work for a contract by the contractor.

transferClientOwnership(address).notice: Transfers ownership of the client account to a new account.

transferContractorOwnership(uint256,addr.notice: Transfers ownership of the contractor account to a new account for a specified contract.

updateAdminManager(address).notice: Updates the address of the admin manager contract.

updateRegistry(address).notice: Updates the registry address used for fetching escrow implementations.

withdraw(uint256).notice: Withdraws funds from a deposit under specific conditions after a refund approval or resolution.

@dev Address of the registry contract.

@dev Tracks the last issued contract ID, incrementing with each new contract creation.
@dev Indicates that the contract has been initialized.
@dev Maps each contract ID to its corresponding deposit details.
@dev Modifier to restrict functions to the client address.

 @param _deposit Details of the deposit to be created.
